title: Reminder than Ignite + electrocute alone = nearly 40% of max hp gone
body:
At lvl 6: 
Ignite does 205 damage.
Electrocute does at least 110 damage (more depending on ad)

315 damage right there. 

Typical mage max hp at lvl 6:
825 (lux)
867(velkoz)
867(brand)

36% of velkoz's max hp is gone to Ignite and Electrocute. Gets worse for adcs and supports.


Now factor in minor runes, hextech revolver or serrated dirk passives, bonus ad from runes.

Over 400 free damage at least approaching nearly 50% of champion max hp at lvl 6. and then the natural burst assassins have...
It becomes pretty clear that even a blind amputee monkey is going to get some 100-0 kills.


What I think should happen:
Decrease Electrocute damage but also decrease the cooldown.
Decrease Ignite cooldown significantly, but also reduce the damage significantly.
Slightly reduce revolver/dirk damage

Why?
This reduces their max burst, but decreases the time between their plays. So you'll see Assassins going for plays more often, but those plays should individually be less impactful.

So, if both players have their summoners up, the player with defensive summoners will be unlikely to die. However, there is a huge window of time where one player has Ignite up and the other does not even have barrier/heal ready.

I'd argue against that point. While Electrocute builds generally DO have reliable kill strategies, they aren't the only strategy. In fact, there are plenty of ways to use runes on every champ to completely dominate.

I for instance rarely use Electrocute outside of {{champion:25}} or {{champion:143}} .

In fact, Phase rush is entirely viable on both, and actually works better on most TANKS than resolve primary runes do (I use Phase Rush on Ornn for instance.

But Phase Rush isn't a damage rune. It's a mobility rune. But it works. On so many champions.

If I'm afraid of divers, you'd be amazed how well Phase Rush works on {{champion:143}} I can run faster than any champ in the game on Zyra. That's how strong it is. It reduces your on board burst, but your damage output per game is about the same because you can risk a lot more engages/pokes.

Yeah. It doesn't exactly argue that Keystones are not playing a major role in champion efficiency, but you're referring to damage runes, and I can play at least 3-4 rune setups on any champion and be relatively effective, and many are not damage runes.

The problem is that assassins aren’t generally viable anywhere that they can’t abuse a weak laner in a short lane.  Juggernauts, Divers, and Duelists will tank their burst, run them down, and then tower dive them.  Tanks ignore them.  Supports make their all-in fizzle.  Marksmen, surprisingly, can poke them out of lane with a Support’s help.  

Assassins want to sit mid, bully a mage, and then take advantage of solo-queue problems like tilt and lack of warding.  It just doesn’t seem like a healthy playstyle when meta. :/

Accusing the other person of being upset as an explanation for their opinion isn’t an argument, though being so rude can make them upset enough to justify it in your mind when they reply.

That said, no other class relies on having  better laning than another class, which must almost always avoid interaction with them.  Mages lose trades and all-ins, and assassins often have enough mobility to escape ganks.  All the mage can do is farm and hope to poke.

It’s just not fun to lane against assassins, and once they have their Duskblade, Gunblade, or Lichbane, you just have to not be around them anymore for the rest of the game.  Note, it’s not fun to play as them in late-game teamfights, either, but that only proves my point about unhealthy gameplay.  They have to fall-off late not to be overpowered.

Recently, shorter game times have made that trade-off worth it.  Hence the midlane assassin meta.
